library(spiralize)
train_and_test = rbind(train, test)

#3
ymin <- min(c(as.numeric(train_and_test$`565HY103H.PV | PURCH/REBURN`), train_and_test$X565HY103H.PV...PURCH.REBURN[,1]))

# Initialize.
spiral_initialize_by_time(xlim=c(head(as.POSIXct((datetime2=as.POSIXct((train_and_test$DateTime), format="%Y%m%d_%H%M%S"))),n=1), tail(as.POSIXct((datetime2=as.POSIXct((train_and_test$DateTime), format="%Y%m%d_%H%M%S"))),n=1)),
                          unit_on_axis = "days", period="months",
                          start=90,
                          end=NULL,
                          flip="horizontal")

# Create the track.
spiral_track(ylim=c(0, 
                    max(c(tail(as.numeric(train_and_test$`565HY103H.PV | PURCH/REBURN`), n=96), train_and_test$X565HY103H.PV...PURCH.REBURN[,1]))*1),
             background=FALSE, background_gp = gpar(col = NA, fill = NA))


# Use a polygon.
spiral_polygon(x= c( train_and_test$DateTime,
                     rev(train_and_test$DateTime) ),
               y=c(train_and_test$`565HY103H.PV | PURCH/REBURN`/2, -rev(train_and_test$`565HY103H.PV | PURCH/REBURN`/2)),
               gp = gpar(col="purple", fill="red"))


# Middle baseline.
spiral_lines(x=train_and_test$DateTime, y=0, gp = gpar(fill = NA, col = "gold3"))
spiral_arrow(head(train_and_test$DateTime,1), tail(train_and_test$DateTime,1), gp = gpar(fill = "#6600CC", col = NA), width = unit(1.5, "mm"))

spiral_text(x=head(as.POSIXct((datetime2=as.POSIXct((train_and_test$DateTime), format="%Y%m%d_%H%M%S"))),n=1), y=ymin, 
            text=lubridate::isoweek( head(as.POSIXct((datetime2=as.POSIXct((train_and_test$DateTime), format="%Y%m%d_%H%M%S"))),n=1) ),
            facing = "curved_inside", just = "right",
            gp=gpar(cex=1, fontfamily="Courier"))
